Tasks.Task Description: Use Azure Monitor and Network Watcher to continuously monitor the health and status of the VPN Gateway. Identify and investigate any anomalies or potential issues.
Regularly check the status and stability of VPN connections. Ensure that all tunnels are operational and investigate any disconnections or performance issues.
Analyze VPN Gateway performance metrics to ensure operations within expected parameters. Address any performance deviations promptly.
Perform failover tests to verify that redundant paths and configurations function correctly and can take over in case of primary VPN Gateway failures.
Review and update security policies, including encryption protocols and access controls, to adapt to changes in the VPN Gateway network or security landscape.
Conduct audits of VPN Gateway configurations to ensure alignment with documented architecture and best practices for the service.
Keep VPN Gateway service documentation up-to-date, including operational procedures, configuration details, and troubleshooting guides.
Perform regular compliance checks to ensure the VPN Gateway setup adheres to relevant regulations and industry standards.
Conduct incident response drills to prepare the team for potential security incidents or VPN Gateway network outages. Ensure familiarity with procedures and protocols.
Evaluate the SLA performance of the VPN Gateway connectivity provider. Address any issues or deviations from the agreed SLA metrics.
Develop and execute plans for VPN Gateway upgrades or expansions as needed. Ensure minimal disruption during these activities.
Ensure the operations team participates in regular training to stay updated with new VPN Gateway features, best practices, and security measures.
Regularly back up configurations of VPN Gateway and connected devices. Ensure secure and accessible storage of backups for potential restoration.
Collect and analyze user feedback regarding VPN Gateway performance and reliability. Implement continuous improvements based on this feedback.
